intro: Callista pugioniformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is often cultivated in gardens throughout temperate regions.
